content.question: If <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the complex fraction with numerator x minus 1, and denominator 1 minus, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, end complex fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equivalent to which of the following?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, 2 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x minus 1, and denominator 1 minus x, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the complex fraction with numerator the limit as x approaches 1, of, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator the limit as x approaches 1, of, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 1 over x, close parenthesis, end complex fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
